items.q: Which filmmaker pioneered the use of the 'jump cut' in his 1960 French New Wave classic 'Breathless'?
items.explanation: He used the radical editing technique to challenge traditional Hollywood continuity.

items.q: The television show 'M*A*S*H' ended with a finale that remains the most-watched television episode in U.S. history.
items.explanation: Over 100 million people tuned into the 1983 finale 'Goodbye, Farewell and Amen'.

items.q: In the film 'Psycho', director Alfred Hitchcock used chocolate syrup to simulate blood in the famous shower scene.
items.explanation: Because the movie was shot in black and white, Bosco chocolate syrup looked more realistic on film.

items.q: What notorious 1980 film flopped so hard it brought down the United Artists studio?
items.explanation: Michael Cimino's massively over-budget film marked the end of the auteur-driven New Hollywood era.

items.q: Who wrote the intense, minimalist plays 'Waiting for Godot' and 'Endgame'?
items.explanation: He was a leading figure in the 'Theatre of the Absurd'.

items.q: What legendary jazz saxophonist released the deeply spiritual 1965 album 'A Love Supreme'?
items.explanation: The album is highly regarded as one of the greatest jazz recordings of all time.

items.q: Which 1970s TV producer created socially conscious sitcoms like 'All in the Family' and 'The Jeffersons'?
items.explanation: He revolutionized television comedy by tackling issues like racism and politics.

items.q: What early video game crash occurred in 1983, severely damaging the North American console market?
items.explanation: It was caused by a flood of low-quality games, notably Atari's 'E.T.'.

items.q: Which legendary French electronic music pioneer broke worldwide records with his massive outdoor concerts in the 1970s and 1980s?
items.explanation: His album 'Oxygène' was a massive global synthesizer hit.

items.q: What 1920 horror film is considered one of the defining works of German Expressionist cinema?
items.explanation: It features a highly stylized, distorted visual design to reflect madness.
